name: Blue Rainbow ApartHotel - Manchester Central

reviews.text: i arrived to find that there was a mix up between the apartments and expedia, they didnt have my room booked, got accomadated on tuesday 9th march and was told that i would be staying somewhere else on the wednesday. got up on the wednesday and checked to see if they knew where id be staying that night to be told that the manager was working on it, at 3pm (22 hrs after arrival) they had finally found somewhere, when i arrived at the new "appartments" i was disgusted, they made faulty towers look classy, atleast one other taxi turned up as we were heading back to manchester with more disgruntled people that had been moved. poor customer service and they had plenty of notice to get me a nicer hotel in the city center but didnt bother, trully disgusted with the way i was treated
reviews.title: excelent but makesure they havent double booked your room, idiots

reviews.text: Only stay here if you are not intending to get any sleep between the hours of 1am and 6am. The Blue Rainbow Apartments fail in my experience to provide the most basic requirement of a place to stay in that they do not enable the customer to get a night’s sleep. The place is incredibly noisy – and I mean LOUD! The apartments design is partly at fault, the large central atrium magnifies the sound of every single door opening and shutting throughout the night and the clumsy window and balcony door mechanisms mean the entire building seems to shake when they are opened and closed. By far the major problem with the Blue Rainbow however is the general clientele it attracts. The vast majority of the customers, who turn up clutching additional duvets and mattresses, return back in steady intervals throughout the night and early morning to continue their partying in their presumably overcrowded apartments. At £150 a night I certainly expected better.
reviews.title: VERY NOISY. Only stay if you are not intending to sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great looking and well specified apartment, accessed of impressive looking central atrium. Bedroom off atrium too, so guests making a noise cause a disturbace you can hear in bed. Little sleep on Satrurday from 2-4:30 am due to inconsiderate residents and a layout that seems to make the noise worse.
reviews.title: Stylish, .....but flawed

reviews.text: I would not stay here on a weekend again, but for a midweek trip it would be fine.
reviews.title: Ticks All The Boxes

reviews.text: Nice staff and a good location.
reviews.title: great place to stay in manchester

reviews.text: There are lots of pretty pictures up, fluffy rugs and bright colours to disguise the fact that this hotel has been thrown together! I also got scalded by the shower so they STILL haven't done anything about controlling the temperature of the water since summer 2009!! Which just adds to my anger!! As i tried to turn the scalding water down the shower screen completely smashed on me, the worst thing about the whole situation is the fact that the staff had no first aid training and just stood there blank faced!!!! I could go into much more detail but water that burns you, things falling off the wall and smashing, staff with no clue, i think thats more than enough to make you realise what a dogdy, shoddy, poorly maintained, poorly managed hotel this is.
reviews.title: Very dogdy hotel!!!

reviews.text: As I was travelling alone I thought an apartment would be easier to prepare meals rather than go out looking for restaurants etc. It worked out fantastically well for me. The living areas were very comfortable and I found it almost eerily quiet which made for two fantastic nights' sleep. The shower was great and breakfast basket so convenient. I'd go back there tomorrow. The free Metroshuttle buses make it a very convenient location too. The only complaints were very minor. It took a whole day to get a couple of lightbulbs replaced and the freezer was out of action as it's likely someone left it open to freeze over. Perfect for a lone traveller mid week in my opinion.
reviews.title: Fabulous, best night sleep ever away from home

reviews.text: We stayed at the Blue Rainbow last year and it was excellent- value for money, generous breakfast ingredients included and good staff. this year, they confused who was staying in which room and this couldn't be sorted out because a trainee person had been left in charge who was very nice but hadn't got a clue, the budget room had no breakfast at all (unlike last year), and the most expensive room offered a very small breakfast including a loaf of stale bread! mmmmm Will definately not be booking for next year!
reviews.title: No longer value for money, staff not helpful, confusion over booking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from Blue Rainbow Manchester I thought I would write a review.I found the staff a mixed bag.The girl who did our first stage of booking by giving me the carpark code was a bit run of the mill,not particularily interested.However once we returned from parking in the secure carpark we were booked in to our room by a very pleasant communicative and friendly girl at reception.Her demeanour was much more attractive than the first member of staff I met.With regard to the carpark,its located on floor -1 and the exit and entry are one and the same.The exit is not signposted and people leaving at the same time as us were all driving about looking for the exit.
reviews.title: Plush Apartments

reviews.text: Our apartment was lovely and clean.Our kitchen was well stocked and did have a microwave unlike another review I read.The boiler located in a cupboard near the front door was noisy but we discovered there is an on off switch just inside the cupboard on the left handside and you can turn off the boiler and thus the noise.
reviews.title: fantastic value

reviews.text: Stayed here for just under a week for work. The apartments are very well laid out and the furnishings are very comfortable.
reviews.title: Nicely furnished, good location

reviews.text: Location is good proximity to shops, restaurants, and bars. The kitchen was good and had everything except a microwave - something which would have been more useful than the oven! I'm not going to cook up a three course meal for myself...
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The all-in-one (movies and internet) option was quite good if somewhat horrendously expensive. An option for longer term access to the internet would have been appreciated.
reviews.title: Immaculate / special service

reviews.text: Since everything had been prepaid, I didn't have any major issues with staff, but they generally seemed quite disinterested in my comings and goings. When I did check out it took a good 5-10 minutes for the desk staff to finish their conversation and pay attention to me.
reviews.title: Awful customer service!

reviews.text: Overall good spot and nice apartments. If you've paid upfront and don't need much from the staff, you should be fine.
reviews.title: Customer Service was dreadful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Blue Rainbow Appartments were easy to find. I was a little worried about finding them after reading other reviews, but we used a sat nav coming from the liverpool direction and it took us to the front door. We went to reception and they directed us to the car park. It took us a couple of drives round the block to find the carpark entrance, but it was just round the corner and we kept missing it!! We were given our room( one bedroomed saver apartment) on the first floor. Before we got there i was wondering whether we should have paid the extra for a premium room, but on entering the apartment absolutely thrilled. It was spotlessly clean, quite spacious and very modern. I was very pleased with the apartment. It had everything that we needed for the whole weekend. As it was valentines weekend there were roses on the bed and in the bathroom which I thought was a lovely finishing touch. The TV was great, 42 inch and a DVD player.
reviews.title: Fantastic apartments, clean and modern
amazing
reviews.text: The bed was very cozy but was quite squeaky! The kitchen had everything we needed for cooking breakfast and tea. there was a washing machine and a dishwasher.
The location was good, 5 minute walk to The bars at Deansgate and a short walk to the shops, bars and restaurants. We went for a beautiful meal at Ego. I would recommend eating there.
reviews.title: Fantastic rooms!!!

reviews.text: There were a couple of bad points but these were only minor things and I would definately go back in the future.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Bad Points: You have to pay for Wi Fi. I took my laptop but I thought the WiFi would be free
reviews.title: Disgraceful

description: ***WINNER MARKETING MANCHESTER TOURISM AWARDS 2009***AWARDED GOLD AWARD-ENJOY ENGLAND 2009/10 one of the top Serviced Apartment providers in the country. - Constructed in 2008, our 80 one & two bedroom apartments are located around a feature atrium overlooking a delightful indoor garden. Features include a 24 hour reception, secure underground parking (£9.50/night), 5 star quality & service, 42” plasma TV, movies & music on demand, Wi-Fi, cabled and keyboard internet available, telephone, 900 thread count Egyptian cotton towels, bedding & robes, goose down duvets, Toiletries from the White Company & Elemis, welcome bag on arrival including milk, orange juice, cereal selection, biscuits, a selection of teas and coffees in every apartment.
